alert.note: Alert for City of Manassas; City of Manassas Park (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 10 at 3:34PM EST until January 11 at 3:50AM EST by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM EST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of northern Virginia, including the following county, City of Manassas, City of Manassas Park and Prince William. * WHEN...Until 700 PM EST. * IMPACTS...Streams continue to flow out of their banks due to excess runoff from rainfall. The gauge at Manassas Park indicates that backyards are flooded along Lake Drive, along with much of the Bull Run Trail system. The gauge in Bristow indicates that Piper Lane is flooded and the guage at Aden in Cedar Run indicates that Fleetwood Road was flooded near Cedar Run. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 333 PM EST, Flooding is already occurring in the warned area. - Flooding impacts will continue, but no additional rainfall is expected. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Dale City... Lake Ridge... Linton Hall... Bull Run... Manassas... Sudley... Manassas Park... Gainesville... New Baltimore... Independent Hill... Nokesville... Aden... Greenwich... - Please visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for flood safety and preparedness information
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.

area.areaDesc: City of Manassas; City of Manassas Park
